sec.p: Hairy roots (HR) and the roots of soil-grown plants (SGR) of R. carthamoides were used as the materials. The transformation procedure, the establishment of hairy root cultures, and the obtainment of the roots of soil-grown plants have been described in our previous study [ 11]. The hairy roots were grown in liquid Woody Plant medium [ 13] on a rotary shaker at 80 rpm, under a 16/8 h light/dark photoperiod with a light intensity of 40 μmol m −2 s −1.
